    • upscaleFrame

      public javafx.scene.image.Image upscaleFrame(javafx.scene.image.Image image)
      Upscale a given Image when it is a lower base resolution than the ImageView.
      Parameters:
      image - Base Image to upscale
      Returns:
      An upscaled version of the same Image

      Changes the current state of the ViewPort based on a Slider's movement.
      Parameters:

    • setSliderValues

      public void setSliderValues(double x, double y, double z)
      Take doubles between 0 and 1 and set the slider thumb positions relative to the given values. Primarily used for debugging and testing.
      Parameters:
      x - sliderX position
      y - sliderY position
      z - sliderZoom position

    • drawPoint

      public void drawPoint(double x, double y)
      Draw a point on the ImageView, using a Circle object.
      Parameters:
      x - Normalised x co-ordinate of the user's click on the ImageView
      y - Normalised y co-ordinate of the user's click on the ImageView

    • drawPoints

      public void drawPoints(Point[] drawPoints)
      Draw multiple points on the ImageView.
      Parameters:
      drawPoints - An array of x and y co-ordinates for each point

      Process a user's input for target resolution.
      Returns:
      An int specifying the target resolution

    • getPointNum

      public int getPointNum()
      Use a stream to find how many instances of Circle objects are actively on the Pane.
      Returns:
      The number of points actively on the Pane

    • getRadio

      public boolean getRadio()
      If the radio button is selected, returns true. If not, returns false.
      Returns:
      Current state of auto radio button

    • getCropFrame

      public int[] getCropFrame()

      Returns:
      Current crop frame co-ordinates
